intro: Chamaecrista huillensis, commonly known as the Huillén legume, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in shrubland or coastal areas. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it has compound leaves with pinnate structure. Chamaecrista huillensis is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
